author: Ausbilder
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
1. Create 2 Powershell Modules called Foo / Bar by creating required Folder Foo and Bar containing  Foo.psm1 + Foo.psd1 / Bar.psm1 + Bar.psd1 files
2. Both modules hold the related PS Class 
class Foo { Foo(){} }
class Bar { Bar(){} }
3. The psd1 Files are configured to load the related Module -> ModuleToProcess = Foo.psm1 / Bar.psm1
4. Put the modules Folder into the $env:PSModulePath
5. Open ISE and try to run:
using module Foo
using module Bar
$foo=[Foo]::new()
$bar=[Bar]::new()

```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Both types are loaded.

Actual behavior
---------------
Only the type of the last using statement is loaded -> Bar
```powershell
Unable to find type [Foo].
At line:1 char:1
+ [Foo]
+ ~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (Foo:TypeName) [], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : TypeNotFound
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->
```

PS C:\Users\Administrator>  $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value                                                                     
----                           -----                                                                     
PSVersion                      5.1.14393.1532                                                            
PSEdition                      Desktop                                                                   
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                   
BuildVersion                   10.0.14393.1532                                                           
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000                                                           
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                       
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                       
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1 
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@Ausbilder Thanks for your report!

It's dup #4112 - feel free to discuss the Issue there.

title: Using module statement is broken?
